message.content:
<<<api>>>: File.createNewFile
<<<code>>>: 
ArrayList<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
names.add("Stephen");
names.add("James");
names.add("Billy");
names.add("Connor");
names.add("Katie");

ArrayList<String> names2 = new ArrayList<>();
names2.add("Carlos");
names2.add("Katie");
names2.add("James");
names2.add("Cameron");
names2.add("Billy");

for (int i = 0; i < names.size(); i++) {
    for (int j = 0; j < names2.size(); j++) {
        if (names.get(i).equals(names2.get(j))) {
            System.out.println("Match " + names.get(i));
            infoToFile(j, i, names);
        }
    }
}

public static void infoToFile(int j, int i, ArrayList<String> names) {
    try {
        File file = new File("name " + j + ".txt");
        if (!file.exists()) {
            file.createNewFile();
        }
        FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(file.getAbsoluteFile(), true);
        BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(fw);
        bw.write(names.get(i) + "\n");
        bw.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that you are not iterating over all the elements in the second list for each element in the first list. The solution is to use a nested loop to compare each name in the first list with each name in the second list. When a match is found, a new file is created (if it doesn't already exist) and the matching name is written to the file.
